decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s):
PS-01( Existing Site Plan, All Floor Plans, Roof Plan, All Elevations and Sections),
P02 rev A (Proposed Site Plan, All Floor Plans and Roof Plans),
PS-03 rev A(Proposed Front, Rear, Side Elevation and Section A-A),
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, in the interest of proper planning.
| Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, all external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building on this site.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies D3 & D4 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7B of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013), polices 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Development (Core) Strategy (2012).
| No part of the flat roofs of the hereby approved development shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7A ,7B and 7D of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013) and policy D3 of the London Plan (2021). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2016 (as amended) (or any subsequent amendment or new Order), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the buildings.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2 & 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D4 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
